channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Duchess leaves hospital with new baby
item.description: Less than 12 hours after giving birth to her second child, the Duchess of Cambridge leaves hospital with her new baby girl -- the fourth in line to the British throne.

item.title: Royals show off new daughter
item.description: Britain's newest princess, the daughter of Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge, and Prince William, made her public debut Saturday in front of the hospital where she was born.

item.title: Crowd waits hours for glimpse of royal baby
item.description: Dedicated journalists and loyal subjects alike waited for hours outside London's St. Mary's Hospital, anxiously awaiting the arrival of the new royal baby.

item.title: Cheeky Federer congratulates royals
item.description: Tennis superstar Roger Federer has taken time out from his Turkey adventure to congratulate the British royal family on its latest addition with a cheeky tweet.

item.title: Name the baby: Could she be a Charlotte or a Tracey?
item.description: The Royal Baby Name Game has begun.

item.title: Duties vs. parties: The difficult life of the 'spare heir'
Boeing Dreamliners could lose all power
Student arrested in North Korea
item.description: A South Korean who lives in New Jersey was arrested last week for crossing into North Korean illegally, the North Korean Central News Agency reported Saturday.

item.title: Police brutality protests across U.S.
item.description: A day after the announcement of charges against six Baltimore police officers, the city -- and nation -- saw rallies and protests Saturday over Freddie Gray's death in police custody.

item.title: Raped 10 year old refused abortion
Nepal quake: More than 7,000 dead
Car show crane collapse kills 1
item.description: A 48-year-old man died and 10 people -- seven of them children -- suffered significant injuries after a crane collapsed Saturday at a car show in the Netherlands, police said.

item.title: Soccer star Rio Ferdinand's wife dies
item.description: English soccer star Rio Ferdinand paid tribute to his "wonderful wife" on Saturday after she passed away following a short battle with cancer.

item.title: Survivor found at mass grave
item.description: At least 30 graves containing human remains have been found in a "detention camp" in southern Thailand, along with a lone male survivor, Thai authorities said.

item.title: Mayweather vs. Pacquiao by the numbers
Filipinos betting on a 'Pacman' victory
item.description: CNN's Ivan Watson is in Manila, where fans are lining up to bet on a Pacquiao victory.

item.title: 'Pacman fever' sweeps across Philippines
Has boxing hit its peak with fight?
item.description: This is the mega-fight. Possibly the biggest fight of our lifetimes, a blue-moon opportunity to see two of the world's greatest fighters go toe to toe. It's Ali-Frazier for the modern era, with media coverage dwarfing even that most famous of fights.

item.title: Why we crave drama of fight
item.description: This weekend, millions of people are expected to tune in to watch two men beat each other up. Why is this?

item.title: Step inside the fight ring
item.description: CNN's Don Riddell goes behind the scenes at the MGM Grand in Las Vegas ahead of the historic Mayweather vs. Pacquiao fight.

item.title: Invited back to North Korea, but why?
American Pharoah wins Kentucky Derby
Soldiers in 'child sex for food' scandal
Rare earthquake shakes Michigan
item.description: A rare earthquake, registering 4.2 magnitude, rattled the western part of Michigan on Saturday afternoon, the U.S. Geologic Survey reported.

item.title: Clashes at Seattle May Day march
item.description: Three Seattle police officers were injured during clashes with protesters at the annual May Day march.

item.title: U.S. official called 'dumb blonde'
item.description: First we were all Americans. Then we were all Charlie Hebdo. Now we're all blonde.

item.title: Nepal: Aid not getting through
item.description: Nepalese Finance Minister Ram Sharan Mahat speaks to CNN's Richard Quest about the problems they are having getting aid from the global community.

item.title: 'Stand By Me' singer dies
Malaysia Airlines offloads superjumbos
'Unselfish' Messi lets Ronaldo get ahead
item.description: The heat is on in Spain -- but Cristiano Ronaldo has overcome his recent goal drought to regain scoring supremacy in his battle with Lionel Messi.

item.title: UK politics: More dysfunctional than U.S.?
item.description: Leeds, United Kingdom -- If politicians feel unloved in America, they should try Britain.

item.title: B.B. King 'in hospice care'
item.description: Blues legend B.B. King is battling health problems, with a message on his website saying the 89-year-old musician is in "home hospice care."

item.title: Why police van death was ruled homicide
Why was this car hidden away for 30 years?
item.description: The Shelby Daytona Cobra Coupe's extraordinary story includes beating Ferrari, being driven by Phil Spector, and finally discovered again after 30 years.

item.title: This site tells you how old you really look
Man hangs up on the Pope -- twice
item.description: Good thing Pope Francis has a sense of humor.

item.title: Chinese 'ghost mall' back from the dead?
item.description: For a decade, the New South China Mall -- the biggest shopping mall in the world -- has been an embarrassment for its owners and China.

item.title: Japanese sex slave fights for justice
First Air Force One wasting away in desert
No dodging this bullet: self-guided ammunition unveiled
Soccer legend making more money in retirement
The best boxing bouts of all-time
Tiny team win $180 million payday
Horses scoring home runs. Yes, really.
Elsewhere it's a family pet. Here it's dinner
The weird, wired cruise ship of the future
Niche cuisine surprise
Expo 2015: The most impressive pavilion designs
Biggest photo contest picks winners
Are these watches worth a million bucks?
Back to the moon: One small step for a robotic chimp?
Latest killer: The self-guiding bullet
Royal welcome
Royals welcome new daughter
item.description: The wait for the second royal baby is over. Officials announce that the Duchess of Cambridge gave birth to a daughter.

item.title: Drone footage captures magnitude of Nepal destruction
item.description: CNN shot incredible new drone footage that captures the sheer magnitude of the destruction in Nepal.

item.title: Photos taken by a tourist of Nepal devastation
item.description: Jesse Anderson, a CNN iReporter, took these photos about an hour after the 7.8 magnitude earthquake hit Nepal.

item.title: Baltimore mom smacks protesting son
item.description: A mother in Baltimore caught her son, whom she suspected of rioting, and hit him. She sent him home on live TV.

item.title: Ring announcer: Pacman and Mayweather 'Ready to Rumble'
item.description: Boxing Announcer, Michael Buffer talks about his famous "Let's get Ready to Rumble" phrase and the mega-fight between Mayweather and Pacquiao.

item.title: From selfie stick to selfie arm?
item.description: Selfie stick gets upgraded to selfie arm! CNN's Jeanne Moos reports it'll make selfies look less lonely.

item.title: Footage shows huge stately home in flames
item.description: A huge stately home in Surrey, UK has burnt down losing centuries of historical paintings, sculptures and antiques.

item.title: Russian spacecraft spins out of control
item.description: Russia is trying to figure out its next steps after losing contact with an unmanned spacecraft on a resupply mission to the International Space Station.

item.title: 100 million-year-old sea monster fossil discovered
item.description: A farmer in Australia discovered a fossil belonging to a 100 million-year-old sea predator known as a "Kronosaurus."

item.title: This is the last man to beat Floyd Mayweather
item.description: Serafim Todorov beat Floyd Mayweather at the Atlanta Olympics in 1996. He describes his life now as 'torture'.

item.title: The Fighters: Watch the full documentary
item.description: Go inside the anti-trafficking fight in the Philippines where one activist wins support from Manny Pacquiao.

item.title: Swiss physicist uses lasers to change the weather
item.description: Nick Glass travels to Switzerland to meet a scientist using lasers to try and manipulate the weather.

item.description: Jacob Lawrence's groundbreaking work, "The Migration of the Negro," is a series of 60 small paintings with text depicting the lives of millions of pre-World War II blacks as they moved from the oppressive South to the promise of a better life in the North. One frame in particular, No. 22, shows three black men dressed in their Sunday best, handcuffed, heads bowed standing in front of a window adorned with prison bars. The caption reads:
